title: Queensland dad shares picture of his young sons and wife in hospital after a horror crash with truck
text:
A father has shared a devastating photo of his three young sons recovering in intensive care after a horror car crash.

David Sellars' wife Rachael and sons Darian, 13, and Ronan, 11, miraculously survived when their car collided head-on with a truck at Gordonvale in northern Queensland last week.

Mr Sellars is now sitting by his family's side while they recover in Townsville Hospital.

The 54-year-old man behind the wheel of the truck was also critically injured and suffered multiple broken bones. He is now in a stable condition in Cairns Hospital.

Rachael Sellars (bottom) and her sons Darian, 13, and Ronan, 11, are recovering in hospital after their car collided head-on with a truck at Gordonvale in northern Queensland early last week

Ms Sellars has a broken pelvis, Darian is able to walk short distances in hospital, and Ronan is recovering with a full leg cast

Mr Sellars is calling for the community to rally around the truck driver, and says he 'feels for him'.

'I'm focused on my family but I recognise that there is a fourth victim in this tragedy,' he told Daily Mail Australia.

'There's this guy who's horrifically hurt... My family have had an outpouring from the community and I hope he's getting enough.'

Mr Sellars said his son Darian's first words were: 'Where's Ronan, how's Ronan and where's mum, how's mum?'

'He's a compassionate kid. I'm so proud of him,' he said.

The father said Darian is now able to walk for short distances, while Ronan is recovering with a full leg cast.

His wife's broken pelvis means she must stay in bed for the next six weeks.

'It's going to be a hard road for all of us,' he said.

'It feels like one step forward, two steps back, trying to get through daily complications.'

Mr Sellars said he can't praise the medical staff and support services enough for their compassion and help.

'I'd like to acknowledge the compassion of the professionals, they've bent over backwards for us,' he said.

A GoFundMe has been set up for the family, with more than $27,000 raised so far.
description: David Sellars' wife Rachael and sons Darian, 13, and Ronan, 11, escaped death when their car collided head-on with a truck at Gordonvale in northern Queensland early last week.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
